title: 'People fear for their jobs if they report bullies'
description: Bafta-winning director Brian Hill on tackling bullying in his industry with new film Toxic.

title: Why this face recognition firm is so controversial
description: If you're reading this, your face is probably on one of the more than 20bn images in this database.

title: CEO Secrets: 'I begged my dad not to give out business cards'
description: Gaby Hersham, CEO of co-working space network Huckletree, shares her business advice.

title: The Zomato and Swiggy riders risking their lives to deliver food in 10 minutes
description: The BBC followed overworked delivery riders as they raced against time to take food to customers.

title: Climate change, albinism and me
description: Coco shares her experience of living with albinism in Nigeria.

title: Johnny Depp v Amber Heard: Actor says he never hit a woman
description: The actor describes his childhood of physical abuse as he takes the stand in a Virginia court.

title: When do parents find out about primary-school places?
description: Councils are contacting parents and carers with offers of primary-school places in England and Wales.

title: Half-price train ticket sale as prices criticised
description: The temporary sale will see some off-peak prices slashed by as much as half in April and May.

title: Jacob Rees-Mogg calls for civil servants to return to the office
description: A "clear message" must be sent to civil servants about ending home working, minister says.

title: Sir Bradley Wiggins says he was groomed by a coach as a child
description: Sir Bradley Wiggins says he was groomed by a coach when he was about 13 and that the experience has "impacted" his adult life.

title: Women's Euro 2022: England matches and Wembley final sold out
description: England's group matches for the European Championship this July have all sold out, governing body Uefa has confirmed.

title: World Snooker Championship 2022: Neil Robertson beats Ashley Hugill in first round
description: Tournament favourite Neil Robertson looks in ominous form as he beats debutant Ashley Hugill 10-5 in the first round of the World Championship.

title: Partygate fines: Boris Johnson set to apologise to MPs over lockdown breach
description: Boris Johnson will apologise for breaking lockdown laws but urge MPs to focus on other issues.

title: Excess weight a clear womb-cancer risk
description: A study of thousands of women across seven countries tries to discover why there is a strong link.

title: Cristiano Ronaldo and partner Georgina Rodriguez announce death of baby boy
description: Manchester United footballer Cristiano Ronaldo and partner Georgina Rodriguez say the death of their baby boy is the "greatest pain any parents can feel".

title: Kabul blasts kill six and wound 11 at boys' school
description: Two blasts outside a high school in the Afghan capital killed at least six people and wounded 11.

title: Partygate: Which Downing Street parties have resulted in fines so far?
description: The police inquiry is separate to the investigation carried out by civil servant Sue Gray.

title: Horse Guards Parade: Man charged after police threatened
description: Prashanth Kandaiah is accused of knife possession and trying to cause grievous bodily harm.

title: Tyson Fury v Dillian Whyte: How 'throwback fighter' Whyte became a world title contender
description: BBC Sport looks at the rise of Dillian Whyte as he prepares to challenge for a world title against WBC champion Tyson Fury at Wembley Stadium.

title: Tyson Fury v Dillian Whyte: Don't treat me like a nobody
description: Dillian Whyte speaks to BBC Sport before fighting heavyweight champion Tyson Fury for the WBC title at Wembley Stadium on Saturday 23 April.

title: MOTD Top 10: Has Gary Lineker finally settled the Frank Lampard v Steven Gerrard debate?
description: On this week's MOTD Top 10 podcast, Gary Lineker settles the Lampard v Gerrard debate once and for all... or does he?

title: Ashleigh Barty to play in golf exhibition series
description: Former tennis world number one Ashleigh Barty fuels suggestions she may attempt a top-level career in a third sport after signing up to compete in a golf exhibition.

title: Elections 2022: How do I vote?
description: Voters are choosing councillors in England, Scotland and Wales, and a government in Northern Ireland.

title: Ukraine children: Killed as he escaped, Elisei is one of 200 child victims
description: As fighting rages across Ukraine, Russia's invasion has shattered the lives of millions of children.

title: Daffodils to treat Alzheimer's could be Welsh hill farming's future
description: Pharmaceutical entrepreneur Sir Roger Jones says his industry needed more of them.

title: Ukraine war: Russia bombards cities as eastern offensive begins
description: Missile strikes are reported in Luhansk and Donetsk as Russia begins a second phase of the war.

title: Ulcerative colitis: 'I was going to the toilet up to 30 times a day'
description: Two young women with ulcerative colitis share photos of their stoma bags to normalise the condition.
